message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest that she was prescribed a medication for anxiety and insomnia. The fact that she started taking extra doses indicates she is developing dependence. Triazolam is a benzodiazepine commonly used to treat insomnia and anxiety, but it is also known to be associated with dependence and addiction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has insomnia and anxiety, and increased anxiety levels suggest that the medication was not working effectively, leading the patient to take extra doses. Triazolam is a benzodiazepine used for insomnia and anxiety, but it is a short-acting drug and can lead to dependence and abuse if used improperly. Buspirone is an anxiolytic drug with fewer side effects than benzodiazepines, but it takes longer to work and is not effective for insomnia. Hydroxyzine is an antihistamine that can be used for anxiety, but it also causes drowsiness and is not effective for insomnia. Propranolol is a beta-blocker used for anxiety, but it is not effective for insomnia and can cause side effects such as hypotension and bradycardia.
